name: OPD-HPI notes
description:
• Location
  • Severity
  • Quality
  • Timing : Constant / Intermittent, how long did it last
  • Duration : When did it Start
  • Modifying Factors : Anything make it better or worse
  • Context : What were you doing when it started
  • Associated Signs or Symptoms

name: Respiratory rate
description: (Match RR with age group and if increased prompt ARI section)				 (<50 for 2-12 months, <40 for 1-5 years)

name: CBIMNCI <2-Status
description: Hypothermia (<35.5 oC = severe hypothermia, 35.5 – 36.5 oC hypothermia, 37.5 oC = fever)

name: PSBI/LBI/NBI-PSBI
description: Convulsion, fast breathing 60 or more/Min, severe chest in-drawing, nasal flaring, grunting, unable to suck/swallow breast milk, budging fontanelle, umbilical infection Extending to the surrounding skin, fever >37.5 oC or severe hypothermia <35.5 oC, Pustular lesion (10 or more in number or single large skin pustule), lethargic or unconscious or less than normal body movements

name: PSBI/LBI/NBI-LBI
description: Red umbilicus, or pus discharge from umbilicus; less than 10 pustular skin lesions, eye discharge

name: PSBI/LBI/NBI-NBI
description: No signs and symptoms of infection present

name: PSBI/LBI/NBI-Jaundice
description:
Severe jaundice-  (Jaundice extending up to hands and feet, Jaundice seen in first 24 hours or after 14th day of birth), 
Jaundice (absence of spreading of jaundice up to hands and feet, Jaundice seen in between 2 – 14 days)

name: Childhood Illness-Diarrhoea present
description: watery stool three times or more in 24 hours, Dysentery: Presence of blood in the stool, Chronic Diarrhoea - Diarrhoea for more than 14 days

name: Childhood Illness-Dehydration status
description:
Severe Dehydration (If any of two given signs present)

	<li>Lethargic or unconscious

        <li>Body movement less than normal

	<li>Sunken eyes

	<li>Skin pinch goes back very slowly (>2 seconds)

	<li>Infant less than one month of age

Some dehydration: 
	<li>Irritable
 
	<li>Sunken eyes

	<li>Skin pinch goes back slowly (<2 seconds)
                                                           
No Dehydration:

	<li>No sufficient signs to classify under severe or some dehydration

name: Breastfeeding frequency
shortname: Breast feeding, How many times in 24 hours?

name: Difficulty feeding or low weight
description:
<li> Ineffective position and/or contact, Ineffective suckling, Breastfed infant for less than 10 times in 24 hours, additional feeding practices along with breastfeeding (soup, or other food), low weight for age, oral thrush or painful lesions inside the mouth 
<li>No difficulty breastfeeding or low weight- Normal weight for age, or no signs of inadequate nutrition
